activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text:
>  The navigate should work, why is it navigating to `/` or going into the refresh loop?

![image](https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/assets/98876115/49b0eef7-e99c-4c66-923e-7f80274167f1)
![image](https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/assets/98876115/37f3c77f-22b6-4859-8689-c6d5bb23ea9b)

The issue arises from the `isAuthenticated` function continuing to return `true`, even when the token is incorrect. Furthermore, I can keep the browsing history intact until the session expiration page, but when I attempt to navigate to the login page, the entire history is wiped clean.

As a solution, I reached out to @rithviknishad , who suggested revisiting the query parameter approach. Now, the recommendation is to check if the origin of the redirect URL matches the origin of care.

@Ashesh3 , I'm currently implementing the query parameter approach.

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text:
> We could use the custom hook we have `useAppHistory` (which would inherently be prone from the attack mentioned before)

As we are doing `window.location.href="/session-expired"` we are losing all the history we have 
tried it with `navigate()` but that is directly changing the page URL to `/` or going on a refresh loop

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text: Maybe we can check if the `history` from `useAppHistory` matches the site domain and then redirect

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text:
now it adds a / in between of the .my.subdomian 
do you want me to sanitise the redirect further like remove any . or other symbols in front of the redirect?
